snippet: European Union members reached a preliminary agreement as part of an effort to make opposition-held areas self-sufficient, diplomats said.
abstract: European Union members reach preliminary agreement that will ease embargo on oil exports from Syria, part of effort to enable opposition-held areas with petroleum resources to develop economic base and some self-sufficiency.

byline.original: By JAMES KANTER and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: James Kanter reported from Brussels, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Hania Mourtada and Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon, and Hala Droubi from Dubai, United Arab Emirates.

lead_paragraph: European Union members reached a preliminary agreement as part of an effort to make opposition-held areas self-sufficient, diplomats said.

headline.seo: Europeans Step Toward Easing Syrian Oil Exports
headline.main: Europeans Step Toward Easing Syrian Oil Exports
headline.print_headline: Europeans Step Toward Easing Syria Oil Exports
